edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math

Class Orientation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math.Orientation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Keyframe

    public class Orientation
extends java.lang.Object
    Information holder class to store the position, rotation, and scale of an object. This is mostly a convenience class to avoid polluting method calls with the same three parameters in many places.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Orientation(Position position, double rotation, Scale scale)
      Creates a new orientation with the given position, rotation, and scale.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Orientation

        public Orientation(Position position,
                   double rotation,
                   Scale scale)
        Creates a new orientation with the given position, rotation, and scale.
        Parameters:
        position - position, where (0,0) is the identity
        rotation - rotation in degrees, where 0 is the identity
        scale - scaling, where (1,1) is the identity

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Gets the position. Modifying the returned value will not affect the underlying position of this object.
        Returns:
        Position object

      • getRotation

        public double getRotation()
        Gets the rotation.
        Returns:
        The rotation in degrees.

      • getScale

        public Scale getScale()
        Gets the scale.
        Returns:
        The scale.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Position p)
        Sets the position.
        Parameters:
        p - new position

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(double r)
        Sets the rotation.
        Parameters:
        r - - rotation in degrees

      • setScale

        public void setScale(Scale s)
        Sets the scale.
        Parameters:
        s - - new scale

      • set

        public void set(Orientation other)
        Sets the position, rotation, and scale of this orientation to that of the other orientation.
        Parameters:
        other - other Orientation

      • copy

        public Orientation copy()
        Returns a copy of this Orientation.
        Returns:
        new Orientation

      • lerp

        public Orientation lerp(double t,
                        Orientation other)
        Linearly interpolates between this orientation and the other orientation. This method modifies the Orientation it is called on, and returns itself. (Advanced functionality).
        Parameters:
        t - interpolation parameter between 0 and 1 to interpolate.
        other - Orientation to lerp towards
        Returns:
        interpolated orientation
